ITTIA DB IoT C API Reference  8.4.1
Modules
Here is a list of all modules:
[detail level 123]
 ▼C APIThe C API provides a low-level interface to the database kernel
 ▼DatabaseA database contains tables, indexes, and sequences defined by the database schema
 TransactionsAll data access operations must occur inside a transaction
 Data Change Notification
 ▼Data TypesLike most database systems, ITTIA DB allows constraints to be put on data stored in the database
 Time SeriesITTIA DB provides a timestamp data type for annotating time dependent values or sensor readings to create a time series data type
 ▼SchemaThe database schema is defined programmatically by describing the fields and indexes that make up a table
 TableA table is composed of fields
 IndexAn index is used to optimize seek, sort, and filter operations
 SequenceA sequence generator is used to obtain unique values
 ▼Data AccessData in an ITTIA DB database is accessed through cursors, both for reading and writing
 CursorA cursor is used to navigate the contents of a table or the result of an SQL query
 Table CursorA table cursor provides direct access to a database table and, optionally, one of its indexes
 RowData is stored and retrieved through rows
 SequenceSequence generators are used to generate unique, increasing integer values
 BookmarkBookmarks are used to remember a cursor's position
 ConfigurationConfiguration options, at both compile-time and run-time can be set to achieve optimal database performance
 Data StreamData streams provide a way to query, filter, and store data in real time
 Error HandlingErrors, warnings, return codes, and related helper functions
 Version
